page.title: 04The Village Policeman
page.content: Meliden and Dyserth each have their own constables,P.C.Steve Harris in Dyserth and P.C.Neil McAdam in Meliden. Both constables are responsible for keeping law and order in their areas (patch). This is achieved mainly through regular foot patrols.Further support is available from Prestatyn Police Station, where Chief Superintendant Owen has overall charge for the district. He in turn is responsible to the Chief Constable of the North Wales Police Force,whose headquarters is in Colwyn Bay. The crime rate in both areas is relatively low, the most frequent crime being burglary.In fact Ysgol Hiraddug and Ysgol Melyd have been broken into during the past twelve months, and electrical goods stolen. The crime detection rate in Dyserth is about 40% .
